title: Cultural heritage: The Politics of Protecting the Past
description:
What is cultural heritage and how it is defined today in various societies? Is heritage a human right? What are the relationships between conservation and sustainable development? What are the existing threats to cultural heritage and how does it relate to tourism? These are some of the questions that this course will tackle. After introducing students to the concept of cultural heritage and how it is
operationalized on the ground, we will look at various theories and politics regarding cultural heritage from a comparative and multidisciplinary perspective.
prerequisite: Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in SC with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
